intro: Potamogeton alpinus subvar. brevifolius, commonly known as the alpine pondweed, is a submerged aquatic plant found in freshwater environments. It has slender, grass-like leaves that are typically shorter and broader than those of the main species, P. alpinus. The plant produces small, green flowers that are clustered in spikelets, which are often submerged or just at the water surface. It thrives in shallow, nutrient-rich waters and is often found in lakes and slow-moving streams. This subspecies is adapted to cold climates and is an important component of aquatic ecosystems.
